intro: Panctenis pedicularia var. ramosissima, commonly known as the hairy stitchwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Geraniaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The leaves are usually oval-shaped with a hairy texture, contributing to its common name. This variety is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
